intro: Cissampelos insularis, commonly known as the island milk vine, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among species in its family. Its vines can grow quite long, often reaching several meters in length. Cissampelos insularis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
